description: From equi- +‎ angular, from equ- +‎ -i- +‎ angular. The addition of -i- is an instance of anaptyxis.

entries.meaning: (geometry) Of a polygon, having all interior angles equal. This is not necessarily a regular polygon, since that would also be equilateral; a rectangle is equiangular but not equilateral, unless it is a square.
